body:
Comment 6: 
I don't understand how I am supposed to use static_conflict.tar.gz to reproduce the
problem. It looks like I have to 'go get gopkg.in/v0/qml', but I don't have the qml
dependencies for that installed and I'd really rather not.

I tried changing the import to just 'import "C"', and that produced a binary with the
.syso inside (as per 'go tool nm') but did not have any problems starting.

If you can provide a completely standalone case, please file a new issue.
_Labels changed: added **release-none**, removed **release-go1.4**._ _Status changed to **Unfortunate**._
